item.title: Cybersecurity Learning Resources
item.description: A list of resources I use to teach myself cybersecurity and recommend. Courses Zero2Automated - Advanced Malware Analysis - In progress Udemy - Chris Greer’s Wireshark Hands-On Course - May 2023 Sektor7 - RED TEAM Operator: Malware Development Intermediate - May 2023 TCM Security - Python 201 for Hackers - May 2023 Sektor7 - RED TEAM Operator: Malware Development Essentials - April 2023 TCM Security - OSINT Fundamentals - March 2023 TCM Security - Practical Windows Forensics - March 2023 TCM Security - Practical Malware Analysis & Triage - February 2023 HTB Academy - Bug Bounty Hunter role path - January 2023 CTFs and Labs CyberSoc CyberDefenders Hack The Box HTB Academy PortSwigger Academy Books Practical Threat Intelligence and Data-Driven Threat Hunting by Valentina Costa-Gazc√≥n Huntpedia Intelligence-Driven Incident Response by Rebekah Brown, Scott J.

item.title: Forensic Lab setup
item.description: This tutorial will guide you through the setup of a Forensic lab using: VirtualBox 7 REMnux + Sift on Ubuntu 20.04 FlareVM on Windows 10 It is mostly a summary of notes I took while building my own lab. Disclaimer Do not follow this guide blindly! Be very careful during the setup of your forensic lab, especially if you intend to manipulate and/or detonate malware. I am in no way responsible for any harm or damage you may cause and you should always make sure you are operating in a safe environment.
